p: Rosin-based high adhesion polyurethane acrylate is a faint-yellow solid. It can be synthesized from hydrogenated rosin, isophorone diisocyanate and 2-hydroxyethyl acrylate according to Scheme 14, prior to precipitation, vacuum drying and column chromatography [ 173]. Its application is an adhesive having a high polymerization rate, low volume shrinkage and high adhesion [ 173].
